history.proof: intros a2 H. unfold osub in H. specialize (H a2 eq_refl). destruct H as [a1 [H1 H2]]. sfirstorder depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
sub: A -> A -> Prop
sub_reflexive: forall a : A, sub a a
sub_transitive: forall a1 a2 a3 : A, sub a1 a2 -> sub a2 a3 -> sub a1 a3

Goal:
forall a2 : A, osub None (Some a2) -> False

Premises:
Some : ?A -> option ?A where ?A : [A : Type sub : A -> A -> Prop sub_reflexive : forall a : A, sub a a sub_transitive : forall a1 a2 a3 : A, sub a1 a2 -> sub a2 a3 -> sub a1 a3 |- Type]
osub = fun o1 o2 : option A => forall a2 : A, o2 = Some a2 -> exists a1 : A, o1 = Some a1 /\ sub a1 a2 : option A -> option A -> Prop
None : option ?A where ?A : [A : Type sub : A -> A -> Prop sub_reflexive : forall a : A, sub a a sub_transitive : forall a1 a2 a3 : A, sub a1 a2 -> sub a2 a3 -> sub a1 a3 |- Type]
pair : ?A -> ?B -> ?A * ?B where ?A : [A : Type sub : A -> A -> Prop sub_reflexive : forall a : A, sub a a sub_transitive : forall a1 a2 a3 : A, sub a1 a2 -> sub a2 a3 -> sub a1 a3 |- Type] ?B : [A : Type sub : A -> A -> Prop sub_reflexive : forall a : A, sub a a sub_transitive : forall a1 a2 a3 : A, sub a1 a2 -> sub a2 a3 -> sub a1 a3 |- Type]
nil : list ?A where ?A : [A : Type sub : A -> A -> Prop sub_reflexive : forall a : A, sub a a sub_transitive : forall a1 a2 a3 : A, sub a1 a2 -> sub a2 a3 -> sub a1 a3 |- Type]
cons : ?A -> list ?A -> list ?A where ?A : [A : Type sub : A -> A -> Prop sub_reflexive : forall a : A, sub a a sub_transitive : forall a1 a2 a3 : A, sub a1 a2 -> sub a2 a3 -> sub a1 a3 |- Type]
osub_Some_Some : forall a1 a2 : A, sub a1 a2 -> osub (Some a1) (Some a2)
option_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : option A -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (Some a)) -> P None -> forall o : option A, P o
option_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : option A -> SProp), (forall a : A, P (Some a)) -> P None -> forall o : option A, P o
option_rec : forall (A : Type) (P : option A -> Set), (forall a : A, P (Some a)) -> P None -> forall o : option A, P o
option_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : option A -> Type), (forall a : A, P (Some a)) -> P None -> forall o : option A, P o
find_none : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), find f l = None -> forall x : A, In x l -> f x = false
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
osub_None : forall o : option A, osub o None
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
String.string_ind : forall P : String.string -> Prop, P String.EmptyString -> (forall (a : Ascii.ascii) (s : String.string), P s -> P (String.String a s)) -> forall s : String.string, P s
lookup_map_none : forall (A B : Type) (x : nat) (e : env A) (f : A -> B), lookup x e = None -> lookup x (map f e) = None
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_gcd : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 c -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b c -> BinInt.Z.gcd a b = c
find : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> option A
nth_error : forall A : Type, list A -> nat -> option A
lookup : forall A : Type, nat -> env A -> option A
option_map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> option A -> option B
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> env A -> list (option B)
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : BinNums.Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
EnvRing.MPcond : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> list (EnvRing.Mon * EnvRing.Pol C) -> Env.Env R -> Prop
hd_error : forall A : Type, list A -> option A
andb_prop : forall a b : bool, (a && b)%bool = true -> a = true /\ b = true
ZMicromega.genCuttingPlaneNone : forall (env : RingMicromega.PolEnv BinNums.Z) (f : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z), ZMicromega.genCuttingPlane f = None -> ZMicromega.eval_nformula env f -> False
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x));...
String.index_correct3 : forall (n m : nat) (s1 s2 : String.string), String.index n s1 s2 = None -> s1 <> String.EmptyString -> n <= m -> String.substring m (String.length s1) s2 <> s1
EnvRing.Pphi : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> Env.Env R -> EnvRing.Pol C -> R
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
EnvRing.PSubstL1_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi ->...-> req (EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi l P1) (EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi l (EnvRing.PSubstL1 cO cI cadd cmul ceqb P1 LM1 n))
EnvRing.PSubstL_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi ->...-> req (EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi l P1) (EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi l P2)
EnvRing.PNSubst_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi ->...-> req (EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi l P1) (EnvRing.Pphi radd rmul phi l P3)
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
String.index_correct4 : forall (n : nat) (s : String.string), String.index n String.EmptyString s = None -> String.length s < n
EnvRing.Mphi : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> Env.Env R -> EnvRing.Mon -> R
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); ARdistr_l : forall x y z : R...
EnvRing.PsubC : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> C) -> EnvRing.Pol C -> C -> EnvRing.Pol C

```coq
intros a2 H.
unfold osub in H.
specialize (H a2 eq_refl).
destruct H as [a1 [H1 H2]].
Qed.```
